title: English Language Familiarization Quiz - Medium Difficulty
description: Enhance your English skills with this quiz focusing on sentence construction, vocabulary, and common expressions.
instructions: Write your answer in English, focusing on correct usage and grammar.
After completing all questions, submit your answers for evaluation.

items.question: Convert to indirect speech: 'She said, "I will be late today."'
items.suggestedAnswer: She said that she would be late that day.

items.question: What is the meaning of the phrasal verb 'to give up'?
Choose the correct word: 'The politician was criticized for his ___ (elusive/elicit) answers.'
Complete the sentence with an appropriate modal verb: 'You ___ (can/might/must) be more careful while driving in the rain.'
Rewrite the sentence using the passive voice: 'They are building a new library in the town.'
items.suggestedAnswer: A new library is being built in the town.

items.question: Fill in the blanks with the correct form of the verb: 'If I ___ (to have) more time, I ___ (to travel) around the world.'
What does the idiom 'to hit the nail on the head' mean?
items.suggestedAnswer: To describe exactly what is causing a situation or problem.

items.question: Rewrite the sentence in reported speech: 'The teacher said, "Don't forget to submit your homework on time."'
items.suggestedAnswer: The teacher told us not to forget to submit our homework on time.
